title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 8.5 - Fraud in examinations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 8.5 - Fraud in examinations

State Regulations
A candidate who with fraudulent intent endeavors to obtain
any credential of the university shall be debarred from entering any Regents
examination until admitted by special permission from the Commissioner of

Education after written application, and any credentials already issued to him
shall be subject to cancellation. This rule includes the use of unfair means to
pass an examination, the alteration of any Regents pass card or other
credential, or intentional misrepresentation in connection with Regents
examinations or credentials. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
8.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
